customer_addr:
E 3971 Cty Rd O
Viroqud, WI 54665

citations.narrative:
Two enclosures had dogs in it that required more space than what the enclosures provided. The first enclosure had two
pomeranians. The two dogs measured 20 inches and 22 inches respectively. These two dogs together required 1,460
square inches of space. The enclosure they were in measured 48 inches by 30 inches and only provided 1,440 square
inches of space. The enclosure was short by 20 square inches of space. Another enclosure contained three boston
terriers. The dogs measured 23 inches, 22 inches, and 19 inches respectively. Together they required 2,250 square
inches of space. They were in an enclosure that measured 48 by 30 inches and provided 1,440 square inches of space.
The enclosure was short by 810 square inches of space.
Cage space requirements ensure that the dogs have enough room to move about freely within their enclosures. It
minimizes the dogs from stepping or sitting in their feces or urine and also minimizes the spread of disease. The licensee
must ensure that all enclosures containing dogs and puppies have enough floor space to meet the minimum floor space
requirements for the number of and the size of the dogs in that enclosure.
Correct starting on 3/29/23.

The licensee does not have documentation that the annual exams have been completed and that the dogs have been
given their distemper and parvo shots. Not documenting or not having the records available during inspection doesn't
ensure the dogs are up to date on their vaccines and that they have been adequately examined by the Attending
Veterinarian. The licensee must be able to make these records available during inspection. Correct starting on 3/29/23.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
End of report.
End Section

narrative:
3.6(c)(1)(i) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
Two enclosures had dogs in it that required more space than what the enclosures provided.  The first enclosure had two 
pomeranians.  The two dogs measured 20 inches and 22 inches respectively.  These two dogs together required 1,460 
square inches of space.  The enclosure they were in measured 48 inches by 30 inches and only provided 1,440 square 
inches of space.  The enclosure was short by 20 square inches of space.  Another enclosure contained three boston 
terriers.  The dogs measured 23 inches, 22 inches, and 19 inches respectively.  Together they required 2,250 square 
inches of space.  They were in an enclosure that measured 48 by 30 inches and provided 1,440 square inches of space.  
The enclosure was short by 810 square inches of space. 
 
Cage space requirements ensure that the dogs have enough room to move about freely within their enclosures.  It 
minimizes the dogs from stepping or sitting in their feces or urine and also minimizes the spread of disease.  The licensee 
must ensure that all enclosures containing dogs and puppies have enough floor space to meet the minimum floor space 
requirements for the number of and the size of the dogs in that enclosure. 
 
Correct starting on 3/29/23. 
3.13(b)

Veterinary care for dogs. 
The licensee does not have documentation that the annual exams have been completed and that the dogs have been 
given their distemper and parvo shots.  Not documenting or not having the records available during inspection doesn't 
ensure the dogs are up to date on their vaccines and that they have been adequately examined by the Attending 
Veterinarian.  The licensee must be able to make these records available during inspection.  Correct starting on 3/29/23. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
End of report. 
 
End Section
